company_context: AppDynamics joins the Splunk Observability portfolio | Splunk Deutsch Francais 日本語 한국어 中文 繁體中文 SPLUNK OBSERVABILITY AppDynamics joins Splunk Observability Ensure resilience with unified observability across any environment, any stack. Explore the Product Get support AppDynamics is part of the Splunk Observability portfolio Splunk AppDynamics delivers full-stack observability linked to business performance for hybrid and three-tier applications. We’re unlocking new use cases, delivering new features, and implementing integrations with other Splunk products, all powered by AI that accelerates troubleshooting and resolution across teams. Use the products that meet your requirements — no migration needed. Optimize hybrid and on-prem performance Deliver peak performance with unique AppDynamics capabilities: Application performance monitoring linked to business metrics — and every network, ISP, API, and service your applications rely on Application security linked to business risk Monitoring for SAP® Solutions Digital experience monitoring Build resilience with unified observability AppDynamics is expanding observability for hybrid and on-prem applications. Cisco is investing in observability as a key product strategy and prioritizing a streamlined, AI-powered experience for AppDynamics and the Splunk Observability portfolio. Use just AppDynamics or AppDynamics and other Splunk products. Observe your full stack Ensure ITOps, Engineering, Network, and Security teams see across: Traditional and modern applications – three-tier architectures and cloud-native apps All domains – on-prem, private cloud, public cloud Owned and unowned networks – from devices and LANs to internet dependencies like CDNs or external DNS providers Get best-in-class observability Achieve full-stack observability with unified visibility across any environment, any stack: See how problems anywhere in your environment impact your business Detect and investigate issues sooner, proactively, so you spend less time in war rooms Gain better control of your data and costs Integration of AppDynamics and Splunk will allow us to make further use of Splunk AI features to analyze our security infrastructure and application data, identify trends and generate critical action items across environments. Dan Field Director of Platform and Network Engineering, United Airlines WEBINAR Splunk + AppDynamics: The Future of Observability Troubleshoot performance and security issues faster, with less toil. conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, my name is Alex and I'm a Sales Development Representative with DeepData AI. I came across your company and was impressed with the work you're doing in observability. I'd love to explore how our data processing solution can help you optimize your operations.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: Hi Alex, I'm John, the CTO. We're indeed focused on observability, but I'm not sure how a data processing solution fits into our current priorities. What makes DeepData AI unique?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Our solution uses AI to streamline data processing, reducing latency and increasing throughput. It's particularly useful for companies like yours that deal with large amounts of data from various sources. We've seen significant ROI for our customers in terms of cost savings and improved performance.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: That sounds interesting, but we're currently invested in the Splunk Observability portfolio, including AppDynamics. How does your solution integrate with these tools, and what would be the cost of implementing DeepData AI on top of our existing stack?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: We do have integrations with Splunk and AppDynamics, which would allow for a seamless addition of our data processing capabilities. As for the cost, our pricing is competitive, and we offer customized plans based on the specific needs of our customers. However, I'd need to discuss this further with our sales team to provide a more accurate quote.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: I see. Well, even if the integration and pricing work out, I'm not sure we're in a position to take on new tools right now. Our budget for this quarter is already allocated, and we're focused on optimizing our current investments. Plus, I'm not the sole decision-maker for new tool adoption; I'd need to involve our procurement team and other stakeholders.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand the budget constraints and the need for involvement from other teams. Perhaps we could discuss a pilot or a proof-of-concept to demonstrate the value of DeepData AI without a large upfront commitment? This could help build a case for future investment.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: Alex, I appreciate the offer, but I don't think that would be feasible at this time. We're not in a position to evaluate new vendors or tools, regardless of the commitment size. Our priority is maximizing the return on our current investments, and I don't foresee that changing in the near future. Thank you for reaching out, but I think we'll have to pass on DeepData AI for now.

analysis.raw:
Score: 4
Outcome: Failure
Key_Objection: Timing
Feedback: The seller should have more aggressively explored the potential for a future engagement or follow-up conversation to re-evaluate the buyer's needs when their budget and priorities may have shifted. Sentiment: Neutral
